alternatives.transcript: for centuries man has shown an awareness of aerodynamics the study of air in motion
the same principles that inspired Leonardo to consider flight today are being used to reach the moon
to design a commercial airliner the Concorde that travels faster than a bullet and a shuttle that explores space and return safely to work

the Mastery of aerodynamics is at the heart of man's efforts to overcome traditional limitations industry of Lies it in designing better products for our everyday lives as well delivering more performance often from less today trains are aerodynamically designed to go 230 miles per hour even Bridges and buildings are built with low wind stress factors more fuel
patient cars bicycles and all their component parts reflect a sophisticated application of aerodynamics

recently these principles have been applied to overcome limitations in a very different industry when Brown & Williamson set out to solve the traditional problems of week taste and difficult draw in ventilated cigarettes it explored the basic principles of aerodynamics in smoking the result is the Barclays cigarette delivering good taste and ease of draw for the first time in ventilated smoking

how do aerodynamics relate to smoking dr. Ajay Baker is a consultant for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration he's also professor of engineering science and mechanics at the University of Tennessee for a number of years I've worked with NASA on developing mathematical models for aerodynamic prediction the same technology used in the Aerospace program can also be used to improve everyday products as well for instance aerodynamics

he used in the design of this cigarette filter for grooves along the outer perimeter of the ACT Ron filter offer pay has a very low resistance for the are all the smoke is moving slowly through the filter air is speeding many times faster through the grooves this High Velocity together with the induced turbulence of the air creates rapid smoke dispersion throughout the mouth this billowing action is a distinguishing characteristic of the silver
I've developed a mathematical model to explain how the ACT Ron filter function

the results of this model show that there are three factors that work the air jets are discrete that is separate they are is moving much faster than the smoke and there is induced turbulence together these factors caused the billowing action mixing the air with a smoke dr. baker has demonstrated how Berkeley disperses spoke through the mouth but why does this smoke dispersal improve flavor dr. Williams

Kane of Yale University an internationally recognized expert in the field of sensory perception of flavor of cigarettes comes from the action of cigarette smoke on receptors flavor receptors that are liberally distributed throughout the mouth and throat these function by means of a process we call spatial summation meaning the more of them you stimulate the more flavor you get Barkley gives especially High flavor by stimulating more of these receptors than the ordinary ventilated cigarette

it does this by billowing the smoke through the mouth as dr. baker has described let's look at how this billowing action really works at Brown & Williamson we developed an apparatus which allows you to see the difference between the way the smoke comes out of Barclays act Ron filter and the way the smoke comes out of others were grilled project manager for the development of barkless glass device is about the same size and shape as the average mouth

it's attached to this smoking machine which takes Puff the same size as the standard testing equipment used virtually worldwide in this test the smoke from a typical ventilated cigarette comes out of the filter and a thin jet like stream which goes straight to the back of the mouth missing many of the flavor receptors the same is true of all ventilated cigarettes except for Berkeley

the Berkeley pop squirrels into the mouth billowing over the entire tongue creating the feel of a mouth full of smoke very much like the way one Savers are fine wine swirling it around the mouth letting it contact all the flavor receptors this allows the full benefit of flavor to be experienced we tested this effect with independent taste panels we found that Berkeley does indeed have stronger flavor and is much easier to draw than the ordinary
collated cigarette

in order to fully understand how the ACT Ron Filter Works it is necessary to understand the normal ventilated filter which allows air into the filter through tiny pin holes around the perimeter diluting the smoke before it enters the mouth the combined air and smoke exit the filter in a thin jet like stream
with the ACT Ron filter as dr. baker has indicated air and smoke each travel through completely separate channels the are moving at many times the speed of the smoke

the air collides at great speed with the smoke as they enter the mouth causing the swirling aerodynamic action that feels like a mouth full of smoke the solution for better taste and easy draw in ventilated smoking

during its three-year development the ACT Ron filter was subjected to an unprecedented number of scientific tests including blood studies smoke analyses pressure tests and analyses of smoked filters fiber optic photography was used to show the effect of the ACT Ron filter in the smokers mouth these sequences show the Akron filter from inside the mouth functioning in normal human smoking

all these tests have conclusively shown by accepted scientific methods that Barkley has overcome the familiar problems of taste and draw while delivering only one milligram proof that Brown & Williamson has successfully applied science and aerodynamic technology to make significant improvements in ventilated cigarettes in this age of high technology consumers demand more often from less
who did unique Akron filter Berkeley has set a new standard bringing the cigarette industry into a new era
